ideologies.name: Marxism
ideologies.description: Analytical framework and revolutionary theory based on historical materialism and class struggle. Emphasizes worker control of means of production.

ideologies.name: Marxism-Leninism
ideologies.description: Soviet interpretation of Marxism emphasizing vanguard party, centralized planning, and rapid industrialization.

ideologies.name: Leninism
ideologies.description: Lenin's theory of revolution through a disciplined vanguard party and the dictatorship of proletariat.

ideologies.name: Stalinism
ideologies.description: Development of Marxism-Leninism emphasizing 'socialism in one country' and rapid industrialization.
key_texts: On the Question of the Policy of the Soviet Government

ideologies.name: Trotskyism
ideologies.description: Left communist theory emphasizing permanent revolution and international proletarian socialism against Stalin's nationalism.
key_texts: My Life: An Attempt at an Autobiography

ideologies.name: Maoism
ideologies.description: Marxist-Leninist theory adapted for peasant-based revolution in agrarian societies, emphasizing protracted people's war.
key_texts: Some Questions Concerning Methods of Leadership

ideologies.name: Dengism (Socialism with Chinese Characteristics)
ideologies.description: Market socialism approach allowing capitalist economic elements within socialist framework. Associated with Deng Xiaoping reforms.
key_texts: On the General Line of the Party

ideologies.name: Titoism (Market Socialism)
ideologies.description: Yugoslav model of decentralized socialism with workers' self-management and market mechanisms.

ideologies.name: Hoxhaism
ideologies.description: Anti-revisionist Marxism-Leninism originating in Albania under Enver Hoxha, opposing both Soviet and Chinese revisionism.

ideologies.name: Luxemburgism
ideologies.description: Left communist theory emphasizing spontaneous mass action and workers' consciousness against Leninist vanguardism.

ideologies.name: Left Communism
ideologies.description: Critique of Leninism and Stalinism from revolutionary communist position, emphasizing workers' autonomy.
key_texts: The Eclipse and Re-emergence of the Communist Movement

ideologies.name: Autonomist Marxism
ideologies.description: Italian Marxist tendency emphasizing autonomous workers' movements independent of unions and parties.

ideologies.name: Autonomism
ideologies.description: Anti-authoritarian tendency emphasizing self-management and direct action against state and capital structures.

ideologies.name: Anarcho-Communism
ideologies.description: Anarchist tendency advocating abolition of state and private property, establishing communes of abundance.
key_texts: Mutual Aid: A Factor of Evolution

ideologies.name: Anarcho-Syndicalism
ideologies.description: Revolutionary trade unionism pursuing workers' control through syndicalist unions and general strike.
key_texts: Syndicalism and the Transition to Socialism

ideologies.name: Syndicalism
ideologies.description: Labor movement theory using strikes and labor organization to achieve workers' control of industry.

ideologies.name: Council Communism
ideologies.description: Marxist theory emphasizing workers' councils as organs of revolution and administration of society.

ideologies.name: Social Democracy
ideologies.description: Democratic socialist orientation seeking to build socialism through parliamentary means and gradual reform.

ideologies.name: Democratic Socialism
ideologies.description: Socialism achieved through democratic processes with emphasis on political pluralism and decentralization.

ideologies.name: Eurocommunism
ideologies.description: Western European communist parties' position accepting pluralism, democracy, and rejecting Soviet Soviet leadership.

ideologies.name: Labourism
ideologies.description: Political movement and ideology centered on labor unions and workers' parties pursuing reformist socialism.

ideologies.name: Anarchism
ideologies.description: Ideology advocating abolition of all hierarchical authority and state structures in favor of voluntary cooperation.

ideologies.name: Individualist Anarchism
ideologies.description: Anarchist tendency emphasizing individual freedom and property rights against collectivist economics.

ideologies.name: Mutualism
ideologies.description: Economic system based on mutual aid, cooperation, and voluntary exchange without capitalist exploitation.

ideologies.name: Libertarian Socialism
ideologies.description: Socialist ideology emphasizing workers' control and direct democracy without centralized state authority.

ideologies.name: Communalism
ideologies.description: Political philosophy advocating community autonomy, decentralized power, and mutual aid.

ideologies.name: Feminism (Leftist/Socialist)
ideologies.description: Political ideology centered on women's liberation and equality, often integrated with socialist critique of patriarchy.
key_texts: Feminist Theory: From Margin to Center

ideologies.name: Intersectional Feminism
ideologies.description: Feminist framework analyzing how multiple systems of oppression (race, class, gender) intersect and compound.

ideologies.name: Anti-Colonialism
ideologies.description: Ideology opposing imperial domination and advocating independence for colonized nations.

ideologies.name: Third Worldism
ideologies.description: Ideology supporting liberation movements and development of non-aligned nations against imperialism.

ideologies.name: Black Radicalism
ideologies.description: Revolutionary ideology centered on Black liberation, self-determination, and end to systemic racism.

ideologies.name: Indigenous Socialism
ideologies.description: Socialism adapted to indigenous cultures, emphasizing land rights, self-determination, and traditional practices.

ideologies.name: Eco-Socialism
ideologies.description: Synthesis of socialism and ecology, critiquing capitalism's environmental destruction and promoting sustainable socialism.

ideologies.name: Queer Leftism
ideologies.description: Political ideology opposing heteronormativity and patriarchy, fighting LGBTQ+ oppression within leftist framework.

ideologies.name: Disability Justice
ideologies.description: Political framework centered on disabled people's liberation, justice, and interdependence.

ideologies.name: Decolonial Theory
ideologies.description: Framework analyzing and resisting the colonial matrix of power, centering knowledge from colonized peoples.
key_texts: The Darker Side of Western Modernity
Coloniality and the Modern/Colonial World System

ideologies.name: Commons Movement
ideologies.description: Political movement advocating for collective stewardship and management of common resources against privatization.

ideologies.name: Afro-Communism
ideologies.description: Communism developed in African context, emphasizing African dignity, self-determination, and collective liberation.

ideologies.name: Agrarian Socialism
ideologies.description: Socialism emphasizing peasant and agricultural worker liberation, rural collectivization, and land redistribution.

ideologies.name: Autonomy Marxism
ideologies.description: Marxist approach prioritizing working class autonomy independent of state and unions.

ideologies.name: Anarcho-Pacifism
ideologies.description: Anarchism combined with non-violence and pacifism, rejecting armed revolution in favor of peaceful transformation.

ideologies.name: Socialized Medicine Advocates
ideologies.description: Movement advocating for healthcare as universal right, managed by society rather than profit-driven corporations.

ideologies.name: Progressive Populism
ideologies.description: Populist movement emphasizing redistribution of power and wealth from elites to common people.

ideologies.name: Libertarian Left
ideologies.description: Left-wing anti-statism prioritizing individual freedom and voluntary association within egalitarian framework.
